iOS 11.title: iOS 11 iPhone GUI
iOS 11.desciption: Origami, Sketch, and Photoshop templates of GUI elements found in the public release of iOS 11.

iOS 11.title: iOS 11 UI Kits for Sketch
iOS 11.desciption: Crafted based on previous version of this kit and Apple’s official design resource, with additional wireframe elements, helps you quickly explore ideas and design app.

iOS 11.title: iOS 11 GUI by Great Simple Studio
iOS 11.desciption: Screens and components of iOS 11 for iPhone X and iPhone 8.

iOS 11.title: Swift Playgrounds
iOS 11.desciption: Learn serious code on your iPad. In a seriously fun way.

iOS 11.title: San Francisco Font
iOS 11.desciption: The system font for iOS, macOS, tvOS, and watchOS.

iOS 11.title: iOS 11 Human Interface Guidelines
iOS 11.desciption: With iOS 11, you can deliver more powerful, user-friendly apps than ever before.

iOS 11.title: Apple Watch GUI for Sketch
iOS 11.desciption: New version includes over 50 band combinations!

iOS 11.title: Angle: 260 Vector Devices & Mockups for Sketch
iOS 11.desciption: Just launched my biggest project since Design+Code! 260 mockups entirely made in vector.

iOS 11.title: Facebook Design Resources
iOS 11.desciption: The design team at Facebook released a really good iOS 9 UI Kit and device hands for presentation.

iOS 11.title: Free Device Templates for Sketch
iOS 11.desciption: Great collection of Apple Device templates made by Robbie Pearce.

iOS 11.title: Android 8.0 Oreo Kit Sketch Resource
iOS 11.desciption: Must-download if you're designing for Android.

iOS 11.title: The iOS Design Guidelines
iOS 11.desciption: The most complete iOS design guidelines I've come across. An essential read.

iOS 11.title: tvOS Human Interface Guidelines
iOS 11.desciption: Whether you’re building a game, a streaming media app, or a utility for the home, keep the following principles in mind as you imagine your app’s identity.

iOS 11.title: Designing at 1x
iOS 11.desciption: With so many pixel densities to deal with, it’s time to design at 1x. Here’s a good workflow.

iOS 11.title: Apple WWDC Videos
iOS 11.desciption:
Get insights into designing and developing for
iPhone, Apple Watch, and Apple TV.

iOS 11.title: What's new in Swift 4.0
iOS 11.desciption: Hands-on code examples to help you learn what's new in Swift 4

Learn Sketch.title: Sketch 4
Learn Sketch.desciption: Sketch is a design toolkit built to help you create your best work — from your earliest ideas, through to final artwork.

Learn Sketch.title: Learn Sketch
Learn Sketch.desciption: A comprehensive tutorial on how to use Sketch 4 and how to switch from Photoshop.

Learn Sketch.title: Craft by InVision LABS
Learn Sketch.desciption: Essential Sketch plugin that generates and duplicate content on the fly. Must-download.

Learn Sketch.title: Zeplin
Learn Sketch.desciption: Design hand-off has never been easier. Generate styleguides and resources, automatically.

Learn Sketch.title: Magic Mirror Plugin for Sketch
Learn Sketch.desciption: Magic Mirror is a Sketch extension (or called plugin) that adds Perspective Transformation to Sketch, so users can create perspective mockups and other distorted effect to their UI design.

Learn Sketch.title: Powerful Start in Sketch
Learn Sketch.desciption: Strong Foundations for your Sketch Workflow

Learn Sketch.title: Sketch Palettes
Learn Sketch.desciption: A Sketch plugin for exporting and importing fill presets. It supports colors, gradients, and Pattern fills.

Learn Sketch.title: Printable device sketch sheet templates
Learn Sketch.desciption: A collection of printable Sketch templates for iOS and Web.

Learn Sketch.title: Magic Presenter
Learn Sketch.desciption: Great plugin for creating a presentation right within Sketch.

Learn Sketch.title: Sketch App Rocks!
Learn Sketch.desciption: Brand new site for Sketch users. Lots of great resources.

Learn Sketch.title: Sketch Master
Learn Sketch.desciption: Training courses to make you a master of the most popular screen-based design tool.

Learn Sketch.title: Abstract
Learn Sketch.desciption:
Abstract is a platform
for modern design teams
to work together.

Learn Sketch.title: Mira
Learn Sketch.desciption: Real-time preview while designing in Sketch.

Learn Sketch.title: Sketch App Sources
Learn Sketch.desciption: Free design resources and plugins - Icons, UI Kits, Wireframes, iOS, Android Templates for Sketch

Learn Sketch.title: Why Your App Looks Better in Sketch
Learn Sketch.desciption: Exploring rendering differences between Sketch and iOS

Learn Sketch.title: Sketch Shortcuts
Learn Sketch.desciption: A list of Keyboard Shortcuts for Sketch App.

Learn Sketch.title: PaintCode Code Generator Plugin for Sketch
Learn Sketch.desciption: Convert your Sketch drawings into Swift or Objective-C

Learn Sketch.title: Sketch Repo
Learn Sketch.desciption: One of the best places to find Sketch resources.

Learn Sketch.title: Sketch Casts
Learn Sketch.desciption: A weekly screencast teaching essential techniques in Sketch. There is a 30sec preview for each video and their first 3 episodes are free.

Learn Sketch.title: Sketch Runner
Learn Sketch.desciption: Runner helps you to get around Sketch quicker by giving you an intuitive interface to supercharge your daily workflow.

Learn Sketch.title: Find and Replace for Sketch
Learn Sketch.desciption: Finds text in selected layer(s) and all layers contained within - and replaces it with different text. Features partial, case sensitive and full-document matching.

Learn Sketch.title: Sketch Icon Font
Learn Sketch.desciption: This plugin helps you easily insert and manage icons from icon fonts.

Learn Sketch.title: Automate Sketch
Learn Sketch.desciption: Make your workflow more efficient.

Learn Sketch.title: How to create a Design System in Sketch
Learn Sketch.desciption: The foundations that need to be laid to start building up a powerful Design System

Learn Sketch.title: Design at 1x—It’s a Fact
Learn Sketch.desciption: The tangible benefits of designing at 1x pixel density

Learn Sketch.title: Pixel Density, Demystified
Learn Sketch.desciption: How pixel density works and how it affects your designs.

Learn Sketch.title: States of the artboard
Learn Sketch.desciption: Create different states and switch between them easily. Just like layer comps for Sketch.

Learn Sketch.title: Sketch Focus Plugin
Learn Sketch.desciption: Add notes and todos directly in Sketch. Also does a lot more.

Learn Sketch.title: Sketch to VR
Learn Sketch.desciption: Design your own VR experience directly in Sketch.

Learn Sketch.title: The Beginner’s Guide to Writing Sketch Plugins
Learn Sketch.desciption: Excellent series on starting your very first Sketch plugin.

Learn Sketch.title: Slicer
Learn Sketch.desciption: Your friendly Sketch slicing helper

Learn Xcode.title: Beginning iOS Programming with Swift
Learn Xcode.desciption: Simon has been writing great iOS tutorials for years. He's just launched his book which will allow you to learn Swift from scratch, all the way to launching your own app. He kindly offered a 20% discount code "designcode" to Design+Code readers!

Learn Xcode.title: Kite - Your programming copilot
Learn Xcode.desciption: A real-time documentation for your code. Looks really useful.

Learn Xcode.title: iOS Goodies
Learn Xcode.desciption: Excellent weekly iOS resources that listed in a simple page.

Learn Xcode.title: Think and Build iOS Tutorials
Learn Xcode.desciption: A great source for high quality Swift tutorials.

Learn Xcode.title: Design with Swift
Learn Xcode.desciption: A full chapter on UI and animations using Swift, made for designers and complete beginners. You get to design in Sketch, learn Swift Playground, edit the UI in Storyboards and execute really cool animations.

Learn Xcode.title: Alcatraz
Learn Xcode.desciption: A GUI package manager for installing plugins, templates, CocoaPods and color schemes for Xcode.

Learn Xcode.title: Fabric - Twitter’s Mobile Development Platform
Learn Xcode.desciption: Implement Crashlytics, Twitter Login and Analytics in a few guided steps. Really useful.

Learn Xcode.title: Iconic.swift
Learn Xcode.desciption: Use vector font icons directly in Swift.

Learn Xcode.title: Raywenderlich
Learn Xcode.desciption: The biggest collection of iOS tutorials for both apps and games. For beginners to advanced users.

Learn Xcode.title: Swift Developer Weekly
Learn Xcode.desciption: There are tons of great Swift resources out there. This wonderful newsletter hand-picks the best ones and send them out weekly.

Learn Xcode.title: Spring: iOS Animation Library in Swift
Learn Xcode.desciption: With Spring, you can animate without code in Storyboard. Great for prototyping, and more.

Learn Xcode.title: Open-source iOS and Android libraries
Learn Xcode.desciption: List of well-crafted iOS and Android controls by Ramotion.

Learn Xcode.title: Realm: mobile-first database
Learn Xcode.desciption: A server-less database that runs directly on the phone. Seems easy to use. Supports Swift.

Learn Xcode.title: Facebook Pop
Learn Xcode.desciption: Facebook Pop is a fantastic library for easily creating spring animations in iOS. This is the library that was used to power the Facebook Paper.

Learn Xcode.title: iOS Design Guidelines
Learn Xcode.desciption: A well-curated list of all the Apple materials specifically for design. You can find a ton of resources and best practices that will get you started efficiently. It's also great for your understanding of design in general.

Learn Xcode.title: Student Developer Pack
Learn Xcode.desciption: A fantastic initiative by GitHub to help students with a ton of free software.

Learn Xcode.title: iOS Dev Weekly
Learn Xcode.desciption: A really well-made weekly newsletter that sends out the biggest news and resources for iOS design and development.

Learn Xcode.title: 15 Days of Animations in Swift
Learn Xcode.desciption: Wanna learn more iOS animation? This is a great resource for that!

Learn Xcode.title: How To Make An iPhone App
Learn Xcode.desciption: CodeWithChris released their free guide to making a Swift app for beginners, touching on Playgrounds, Autolayout and more.

Learn Xcode.title: Swift Toolbox
Learn Xcode.desciption: An awesome community-driven site with a healthy list of libraries for Swift.

Learn Xcode.title: Swifty - Code Swift on your iPhone
Learn Xcode.desciption: Learn the Swift language directly on your iPhone.

Learn Xcode.title: 30 Days of Swift
Learn Xcode.desciption: 30 Swift projects made by a designer and shared on GitHub. Great for learning.

Learn Xcode.title: CocoaPods
Learn Xcode.desciption: CocoaPods is THE library management for iOS. You can quickly find projects that you can import to your own or simply open and analyze the content.

Learn Xcode.title: Swiftris - Build Your First iOS Game
Learn Xcode.desciption: A lot of us dream of building our very own iOS game. This is a good start.

Prototyping Tools.title: Origami 2.0 - Prototyping Tool
Prototyping Tools.desciption: Origami was just updated with Sketch and Live Preview and code support.

Prototyping Tools.title: Prototyping Animation with Keynote
Prototyping Tools.desciption: There's no denying that Keynote is a beautiful presentation software. But if you spend a little more time on it, you can even figure out how to prototype with it.

Prototyping Tools.title: Framer Studio
Prototyping Tools.desciption: Framerjs just released a Mac app to help you build prototypes with more ease.

Prototyping Tools.title: CREO: Native App Design and Development Reinvented
Prototyping Tools.desciption: This shiny new tool lets you prototype and build apps with more ease than Xcode. It’s like Storyboard inside an app.

Prototyping Tools.title: Form: Instant Native Prototypes
Prototyping Tools.desciption: A powerful prototyping tool that uses a much improved version of the mechanics found in Quartz Composer. Form is completely native and allows you to preview directly on your devices. Get the free trial.

Prototyping Tools.title: Principle – Animate Your Ideas
Prototyping Tools.desciption: Insanely simple prototyping tool. In about 5 minutes, I managed to get something animated. We’re really lucky to have this.

Prototyping Tools.title: Prototyping with iAd Producer
Prototyping Tools.desciption: Who knew you could prototype with iAd Producer. Looks very impressive.

Prototyping Tools.title: Flinto for Mac
Prototyping Tools.desciption: One of the best prototyping tools just went native, with a Sketch plugin and an iOS app for previewing.

Productivity Mac Apps.title: Hype 3 Professional
Productivity Mac Apps.desciption: Played a little with this. This tool has so much potential. Allows you to quickly animate things and export to HTML 5.

Productivity Mac Apps.title: CloudApp
Productivity Mac Apps.desciption: I've been using CloudApp for 2 years now. It's a really effective way to share images and videos online. The auto-upload screenshots and Web viewing experience are some of the features that set this app apart.

Productivity Mac Apps.title: Giphy for Mac
Productivity Mac Apps.desciption: This app lets you screencapture anything into a GIF.

Productivity Mac Apps.title: Noun Project for Mac
Productivity Mac Apps.desciption: Drag and drop vector icons to Sketch from this Mac app, which has over 100K icons in its collection.

Productivity Mac Apps.title: Lingo for Mac
Productivity Mac Apps.desciption: You can store all your visual assets, which can be easily dragged to Sketch.

Productivity Mac Apps.title: Ulysses 2.0
Productivity Mac Apps.desciption: My favorite writing app just launched 2.0. You’ll love the export feature.

Productivity Mac Apps.title: LiceCap
Productivity Mac Apps.desciption: The strangiest, yet simplest and most effective GIF creating tool you can find.

Productivity Mac Apps.title: Fantastical
Productivity Mac Apps.desciption: I use Fantastical for adding quick todos and setting up calendar events in a natural language: Tea at 1pm Saturday. Boom.

Productivity Mac Apps.title: PaintCode
Productivity Mac Apps.desciption: PaintCode is useful to turn drawings into code and manipulate them for UI and animations.

Productivity Mac Apps.title: Product Hunt for Mac
Productivity Mac Apps.desciption: Get the latest products directly on your Mac's menu bar.

Productivity Mac Apps.title: Dash - Offline API Documentation
Productivity Mac Apps.desciption: An indispensable tool for developers to check documentations offline for languages such as Angular, Swift, CSS, etc.

Productivity Mac Apps.title: Screenflow
Productivity Mac Apps.desciption: Screenflow may look like a dated and scary tool at first, but it's truly a gem. You cannot find a better screencasting tool out there. It's so good that you can use this for editing all your videos as well. Really intuitive and powerful UI.

Productivity Mac Apps.title: Iconjar
Productivity Mac Apps.desciption: Promising new app for managing icons. Check out their freebies.

Productivity Mac Apps.title: Pixave 2
Productivity Mac Apps.desciption: Since Ember has been discontinued, this is easily the best replacement.

Productivity Mac Apps.title: Atom 1.0
Productivity Mac Apps.desciption: A big milestone of the code editor by GitHub. Check out their video.

Productivity Mac Apps.title: Google Analytics by Email
Productivity Mac Apps.desciption: Get beautiful analytics in your inbox daily, weekly and monthly. The amount of data is impressively well-organized.

Find Inspiration.title: Medium
Find Inspiration.desciption: Medium is a platform for creative thinkers. You can find quality articles just about everything.

Find Inspiration.title: Dribbble
Find Inspiration.desciption: Dribbble is the best place to find inspiration for visual design. A lot of great designers are posting there regularly.

Find Inspiration.title: Sidebar.io
Find Inspiration.desciption: The best 5 design articles shared daily to your inbox.

Find Inspiration.title: Design Resources from Bjango
Find Inspiration.desciption: Very complete App Icon template for Sketch, Affinity Designer, Photoshop and Illustrator.

Find Inspiration.title: Product Hunt
Find Inspiration.desciption: A fantastic site that promotes the best Web and mobile apps that are coming daily.

Find Inspiration.title: Oozled
Find Inspiration.desciption: The best resources for designers. You can create your own collection and share with others.

Find Inspiration.title: Hey, Designer
Find Inspiration.desciption: A site that consistently puts out the best design resources out there. Definitely follow their stream.

Find Inspiration.title: Designer News
Find Inspiration.desciption: Designers News is the best place to find daily articles about design and an active community behind it.

Find Inspiration.title: Panda 4
Find Inspiration.desciption: Panda, the newsfeed dashboard for designers just got a lot better. Definitely check out their new features.

Learn Colors.title: Color Template
Learn Colors.desciption: Understanding how colors work, how they complement each other and when to use them is crucial to the branding and usability of your app. First, I suggest reading this guide about colors. It explains the theory behind colors.

Learn Colors.title: Adobe Kuler
Learn Colors.desciption: Adobe Kuler is pretty smart at detecting the colors from your images and customize the palette of your choice.

Learn Colors.title: Sip for Mac and iPhone
Learn Colors.desciption: Great tool for working with colors. Supports Swift.

Learn Colors.title: Skala Color 2.0
Learn Colors.desciption: An exceptional color picker with Swift and HEX support.

Learn Colors.title: Material Palette
Learn Colors.desciption: Quickly create your own Material color palette and see it apply to a design.

Learn Colors.title: Material Design - Color
Learn Colors.desciption: A fantastic guide about colors from Google's Material design.

Learn Typography.title: Peace Sans - Free
Learn Typography.desciption: For a free font, this is great. Go grab it.

Learn Typography.title: Google Webfonts
Learn Typography.desciption: With Google Webfonts, you can download a limited selection of fonts for free and use them in your projects as you see fit. It's as good as it gets as far as free goes.

Learn Typography.title: Guide to Pairing Fonts
Learn Typography.desciption: Typography has been established for a long time, and there is certainly much to learn about it. This guide is particularly helpful to help you pair fonts based on a set of criterias.

Learn Typography.title: Font Awesome Symbols for Sketch
Learn Typography.desciption: Opening this Sketch file will allow you to quickly insert a Font Awesome icon. Clever.

Learn Typography.title: Typography in 10 minutes
Learn Typography.desciption: Good typography makes us want to read, so it's best to focus on its utility. Let’s look at these 5 rules of good typography and apply them to modern design for mobile and for Websites.

Learn Typography.title: Bebas Neue
Learn Typography.desciption: Nice Helvetica replacement that comes for free. Must-download.

Learn Typography.title: Space Mono Font
Learn Typography.desciption: A new monospaced typeface available on Google Fonts.

Learn Typography.title: Type Genius - Find Matching Fonts
Learn Typography.desciption: Select your favourite font and Type Genius will suggest a matching font. Easy enough.

Learn Typography.title: Typography Guide
Learn Typography.desciption: If you'd like to learn more about combining typefaces, apostrophes, quotes, dashes and brackets, I suggest heading to typogui.de

Learn Typography.title: Typekit
Learn Typography.desciption: We're very lucky to have an extremely affordable service such as Typekit that is part of the Creative Cloud subscription. The selection is more limited compared to other services, but still very good. Perfect for those who are starting.

Learn Typography.title: Hand Lettering
Learn Typography.desciption: There is also a fascinating course for hand lettering. With these techniques, you can create logos, personal brands and explore typography in general.

Learn Typography.title: Google Noto Fonts
Learn Typography.desciption: Google now has a font family that works across devices and comes in 800 languages. Free download.

Learn Typography.title: Blokk: Font for wireframing
Learn Typography.desciption: Instead of using Lorem Ipsum for mockups, it’s best to use this font. Perfect for wireframing.

Learn Typography.title: OpenFoundry
Learn Typography.desciption: Beautiful open-source fonts in well-crafted demos.

Learn Typography.title: I love typography
Learn Typography.desciption: Beautiful and inspiring typography studies and weekly type recommendations. There are rare gems that I would never have found otherwise. As someone who knows little about the deep history of typography, this site comes in handy.

Learn Typography.title: Cooper Hewitt - A beautiful free font
Learn Typography.desciption: A gorgeous typeface that is made free. A must download if you love typography.

Learn Typography.title: Input: font designed for code
Learn Typography.desciption: A great font specifically made for coding. Beautiful, smart and versatile.

Learn about Icons.title: Simple Icons
Learn about Icons.desciption: All the logos from popular brands downloadable in SVG.

Learn about Icons.title: Stream Line
Learn about Icons.desciption: A slightly more curvy and fun style to the iOS 7 theme. If you seek something a little different, this is it. The collection is humongous – it even has a Sketch file included, which is useful.

Learn about Icons.title: Simple Line Icons
Learn about Icons.desciption: 100+ simple line icons for web and UI design available for free; checks the preview file to see all the icons.

Learn about Icons.title: Pixel Love
Learn about Icons.desciption: This icon set is perfectly aligned with the default iOS style. It is currently my favorite to use because of its clean look and elegant proportions.

Learn about Icons.title: Minimalistic Everyday Icons
Learn about Icons.desciption: A free set of minimalistic icons up for grabs!

Learn about Icons.title: A Juicy & Delicious Icon Set
Learn about Icons.desciption: A good-looking and unique collection of 200 icons for only 9 bucks. Also available for Sketch.

Learn about Icons.title: Instant Logo Search
Learn about Icons.desciption: An essential site for finding SVG logos for your designs.

Learn about Icons.title: Hawcons: Over 500 free icons
Learn about Icons.desciption: Another large set of Fill and Solid icons. The Gestures, Emoji and Documents sets are good to have.

Learn about Icons.title: SketchActive: free sets of 360 icons
Learn about Icons.desciption: A useful set of free icons for Sketch ranging from iOS defaults to sweets, party and business.

Learn about Icons.title: 2,086 icons for iOS, Android and Web
Learn about Icons.desciption: A massive collection of icons for every need you can imagine.

Learn about Icons.title: Material icons - Google Design
Learn about Icons.desciption: Google just updated their Material Design icons. Here’s a good download.

Learn about Icons.title: Icons8 App With 26,000 Icons
Learn about Icons.desciption: A huge library of icons easily accessibly from a Mac app.

Learn about Icons.title: 440 Free Icons for Sketch
Learn about Icons.desciption: Another great set of icons in line and solid modes. A nice change of style: bolder and more rounded.

Learn about Icons.title: CompassCons: 300 free icons
Learn about Icons.desciption: Very nice set of icons made with Sketch.

Learn about Icons.title: Simple Line Icons 2 for Sketch
Learn about Icons.desciption: Over 100 icons made specifically for Sketch. And it's free.

Learn about Icons.title: Evil Icons
Learn about Icons.desciption: Nice collection of free SVG icons. Available for Sketch as well.

Learn about Icons.title: Pixeden Icons
Learn about Icons.desciption: The latest volume of our iOS7 tab bar icons series with 32 icons to help you design your next project with line or full icons style.

Learn about Icons.title: Citysets Icons
Learn about Icons.desciption: Beautiful collections of icons based on the cities in the world.

Learn about Icons.title: Dripicons V2
Learn about Icons.desciption: Lovely (and free) set of 200 icons.

Learn about Icons.title: 54 Free Sketch Icons
Learn about Icons.desciption: Great set of pixel-perfect icons for iOS design.

Learn about Icons.title: IconStore - Free Icon Packs
Learn about Icons.desciption: Seriously awesome list of free icon packs. What a treat.

Learn about Icons.title: Kameleon, 1500 Icons That Changes Color
Learn about Icons.desciption: A large collection of flat icons in multiple colors.

Learn about Icons.title: Glyphish for WatchKit
Learn about Icons.desciption: Beautiful Icon set for Apple Watch.

Learn about Icons.title: 850 Scalable Vector Line Icons
Learn about Icons.desciption: A great collection of vector icons.

Learn about Icons.title: Swifticons 2
Learn about Icons.desciption: Beautiful set of icons that comes in 4 styles.

Learn about Icons.title: to [icon]
Learn about Icons.desciption: Over 1,100 SVG icons searchable on this fantastic site. For free. Perfect for Sketch.

Learn about Icons.title: Lynny Icon Set - Free
Learn about Icons.desciption: Hard to say no to a nice set of 450 icons like these.

Learn about Icons.title: Flaticon: Over 59,000 Icons
Learn about Icons.desciption: It's just mind-blowing how many icons there are in this site. And it's all searchable.

Learn about Icons.title: Material Design Icons
Learn about Icons.desciption: Google released their icon sets that you can use to design your Android UIs.

Learn about Icons.title: 300+ Free Flat Color Icons
Learn about Icons.desciption: Colored icons in SVG format. You can import to Sketch and use Make Grid to organize them.

Learn about Icons.title: Free 50 Flat Icon Pack - Squid Ink
Learn about Icons.desciption: Neat collection of flat coloured 2000 icons. 50 of them are free.

Learn about Icons.title: SmartIcons - 1450 Free Icons
Learn about Icons.desciption: Great collections of free icons both for Web and for Mobile.

Learn about Icons.title: Free Icon Set
Learn about Icons.desciption: A unique set of free icons. Definitely grab it.

Learn about Icons.title: Pictos Redux
Learn about Icons.desciption: A great looking set of icons made by Drew Wilson.

Learn about Icons.title: The Bezier Game
Learn about Icons.desciption: A clever game that allows you to learn how to create icons and vector graphics.

Learn about Icons.title: Icon54
Learn about Icons.desciption: A top notch set of 2100 icons for Mobile and Web.

Use Sounds.title: dev_tones - 500+ UI Sounds
Use Sounds.desciption: A large collection of UI sounds that you can use for your app.

Use Sounds.title: Sonics - Free UI Sounds
Use Sounds.desciption: Get free UI sounds to your inbox monthly. High quality stuff.

Use Sounds.title: Freesounds.org
Use Sounds.desciption: A really large collection of sounds for all kinds of purposes. The sounds are free and I would suggest using the Search to find the little gems.

Use Sounds.title: Octave
Use Sounds.desciption: A nice list of UI sounds that you can use for your iOS app.

Marketing.title: Advice on Building a Press List
Marketing.desciption: Dan Counsell, founder of RealMac Software, gives us a much needed insight on how to get media coverage by actively keeping contacts and sending emails.

Marketing.title: App Review Monitor
Marketing.desciption: Useful tool for keeping track of the App Store reviews that you get.

Marketing.title: Brick by Brick
Marketing.desciption: Building a community for your app is crucial to its success. This free guide will help you.

Marketing.title: App Making Guide
Marketing.desciption: After you put hundreds of hours building your app, you have to market it. This comprehensive guide will give you a head start by providing valuable insights and press kit templates.

Marketing.title: How Much Should I Charge?
Marketing.desciption: Understanding the value of your work is important when it comes to freelance. This site does a good job at tell you.

Learn from iOS Courses.title: General Assembly
Learn from iOS Courses.desciption: The courses are expensive, but they run for 8-12 weeks and you get a proficient teacher that knows their materials. You can take the courses part-time or full-time.

Learn from iOS Courses.title: Treehouse
Learn from iOS Courses.desciption: A comprehensive list of iOS courses for a monthly subscription. Treehouse is considered one of the best places to start learning about a variety of subject.

Learn from iOS Courses.title: TheCodePath
Learn from iOS Courses.desciption: They offer great introductory courses to learn iOS development that is approachable for designers. The courses show you how to use Interface Builder and how to build animations.

Learn from iOS Courses.title: 50 Top-Drawer Websites to Learn Web Design and Development
Learn from iOS Courses.desciption: A ton of great courses for learning Web design and code.

UI.title: Pixel Perfect Precision Handbook
UI.desciption: A super detailed guide on pixel perfection.

UI.title: Pexels
UI.desciption: Fantastic source for stock photos. You can easily search the photos.

UI.title: UI Gradients
UI.desciption: iOS is known to use beautiful gradients. You can incorporate them inexpensively for your UIs by having two colors that complement each other.

UI.title: 7 Rules for Creating Gorgeous UI
UI.desciption: A well-written article about visual design and how to effectively use colors, lighting and spacing to create a nice UI.

UI.title: Designer's guide to DPI
UI.desciption: Excellent introduction to pixel density for both iOS and Android.

UI.title: Material Design Lite
UI.desciption: Material Design is now made into a library for the Web. Released by Google.

UI.title: Pttrns - iOS UI Patterns
UI.desciption: A super useful list of all the iOS UI patterns, from login screens to user on-boarding.

UI.title: Material Design is Different, Not Better
UI.desciption: Before you consider applying Material Design for everything, it’s important to consider its strengths and weaknesses.

UI.title: Design Details
UI.desciption: Design exploration to all the fine details of popular apps.

UI.title: The Art of UI Animations
UI.desciption: Everything you need to know about UI animations.

UI.title: 100 Free High Resolution Photorealistic Mockups
UI.desciption: A massive list of resources for presenting your designs in realistic mockups.

UI.title: TETHR - UI Kit
UI.desciption: A wicked UI Kit made in Sketch and Photoshop. Free resource.

UI.title: On Visual Hierarchy
UI.desciption: A short but well-explained article on how to prioritize your design elements.

UX.title: UX Companion App
UX.desciption: If you want to learn all about UX, this is a nice app that'll explain all the theories, tools and principles.

UX.title: IDEO Design Kit
UX.desciption: A thorough guide to design, from inspiration to implementation from the design team at IDEO.

UX.title: Design Principles
UX.desciption: While it’s good to learn about techniques and trends, what reinforce them are your design principles.

UX.title: The Basics Of Designing Mobile Apps
UX.desciption: A nice introduction to designing for Mobile. Well-written and with a bunch of useful insights.

UX.title: Techies Project
UX.desciption: An incredibly diverse list of interviews that touches on important and delicate topics.

UX.title: Mobile Is Eating the World
UX.desciption: If this doesn't convince you to design for mobile, then I don't know what will.

Videos.title: Elements of Design
Videos.desciption: A gorgeous video showing perfectly executed animations and transitions. Fantastic inspiration for your iOS app.

Videos.title: Animation basics: The art of timing and spacing
Videos.desciption: Great TED video explaining the basics of animation in a very illustrative way.

Videos.title: THE GAP by Ira Glass
Videos.desciption: One of the most important videos to watch for creative people.

Videos.title: AltConf 2015 Videos
Videos.desciption: A long list of videos to watch next to the WWDC videos from influential designers and developers.

Videos.title: The illusion of life
Videos.desciption: A must-watch for lovers of animations. While not everything can be used for UI animations, the principles are worth considering.

Web.title: CSS Animation for Beginners
Web.desciption: A great intro to CSS animations for beginners.

Web.title: Pace: Automatic page load progress bar
Web.desciption: A beautiful loading indicator for your Website with a few lines of code.

Web.title: Simple Responsive Charts
Web.desciption: Creating dynamic charts for your Website can be a daunting task. This is a great library that will solve your problem.

Web.title: uilang - Minimal, UI-focused code for Web designers
Web.desciption: A simple, beautifully crafted scripting language for Web designers. Great for prototyping.

Web.title: voxel.css
Web.desciption: Powerful new framework that allows you to create 3D with CSS transitions.

Web.title: Dynamics.js
Web.desciption: A very cool library for creating physics-based animations in Javascript.

Web.title: CSS Icon
Web.desciption: 512 icons written completely in CSS for you to use.

Web.title: CSS Reference by Codrops
Web.desciption: A really well-designed site for referencing the CSS properties, all explained with images and code sample.

Web.title: 9 basic principles of responsive web design
Web.desciption: Understanding responsive design has never been this important. Now, we have to design for countless devices, all with different resolutions.

Web.title: Meteor 1.0
Web.desciption: If you're looking to build a Web app from scratch, Meteor is the perfect framework. With a few lines of code, you can create powerful apps using solid templates.

Web.title: Anime.js
Web.desciption: You can do pretty crazy animations with this.

Web.title: Background Blur CSS
Web.desciption: Apple used the Webkit Backdrop Filters for their new Apple Watch site. Learn how to do it.

Web.title: Popmotion - JavaScript animation, physics and input tracking
Web.desciption: Looks like a powerful javascript animation library with touch input support.

Web.title: SVG Loaders
Web.desciption: A beautiful list of loading animations made in SVG.

Web.title: A-Frame - Building blocks for the virtual reality web
Web.desciption: VR is coming to the Web. This is how to start.
